events.name: Google I/O Extended 2017 - Milton Keynes
events.description:
Come to the launch of GDG Milton Keynes!

17:00 - Registration and refreshments

18:00 - Keynote (streamed live from the Shoreline Amphitheatre in Mountain View, CA)

20:00 - Refreshments and networking

20:30 - Announcements

21:00 - Developer keynote

22:00 - Close

events.name: General talks - Cloud Firestore, Cloud Functions and the GDPR
events.description:
Session 1:
There have been many changes to the Firebase Database in the last 12 months. We'll be taking a look at Cloud Firestore, how it differs to the Firebase RTDB and which you should use for your application. The talk will also discuss issues around latency, data sharding and solutions to common scenarios.

Session 2:
With the deadline for GDPR fast approaching, we'll be looking at essentials around compliance with the GDPR and how you can use Google Cloud's Data Loss Prevention API to redact / obfuscate data.

Session 3:
Just add code. We'll take a look at how Cloud Functions can be used to create fully managed, scalable, on-demand microservices, to transform data, manipulate images / audio or connect to 3rd party APIs.

Pizza and drinks
events.how_to_find_us:
Please use the entrance for Unit 25 (Skyline Taxis)

What 3 Words: redouble.gashes.robe

events.name: General talks - Cloud TTS & Cloud Functions
events.description:
Our monthly talks / hacks / meetups

This month, we'll be looking at Google Cloud's newest products.

Cloud Text-to-Speech
Google's Cloud TTS has been developed using DeepMind technology to create WaveNet voices, an amazing new era in text to speech, where more naturally sounding speech can be produced. Dolphin ONE were one of the launch partners for this product

Cloud Functions for Firebase v1.0.0
We'll show you what you can do with Cloud Functions and some of the changes in version 1
events.how_to_find_us: Please use the entrance for Unit 25 (Skyline Taxis).  Your sat nav may take you to the back door.

events.name: Google I/O Extended 2018 Milton Keynes
events.description:
We'll be livestreaming the Google I/O keynote sessions along with activities during the break and an opportunity to win a Google Home Mini.

Venue: The Pinnacle, Transport Systems Catapult, 170 Midsummer Boulevard, Milton Keynes

17:30 - Registration and drinks
18:00 - Main keynote (streamed live)
19:30 - Refreshments, retro gaming and networking (maybe a Code Lab)
21:00 - Developer keynote (streamed live)

If you are attending, please complete this form for details of food, swag, etc. https://goo.gl/forms/FUAScJNf8iPjXKS62

events.name: General talks - More from Google I/O
events.description: This month, we'll be looking at some of the technologies announced during Google I/O.

events.name: GDG MK Launch + WomenTechmakers + Google Machine Learning update
events.description:
Our June meetup will be a joint meetup with GDG MK and GirlsCodeMK.

Speakers announced so far:
Rupert Whitehead, Google UK - Google Developer Groups
Gen Ashley, Women Techmakers - Women Techmakers
Rupert Whitehead, Google UK - So what's Google doing with machine learning?

Pizza and drinks

events.name: General talks
events.description: Unfortunately, TSC is unavailable on our usual meeting date, this month. We've had to postpone until next month. Sorry!

events.name: Cloud Next 18 announcements / Tensorflow.js
events.description:
Cloud Next '18 announcements
This month, we'll be taking a look at some of the announcements made at this year's Cloud Next 18 in San Francisco.

Using Tensorflow.js
Marcus Hitchins will be demonstrating how Kano use Tensorflow.js to empower children's toys and projects.

This will also be our last meeting at the Transport Systems Catapult. They are downsizing and will no longer have the space available.

events.name: General talks

venue.name: GirlsCode Office, Block E, Bletchley Park
venue.address_1: Bletchley Park, next to the submarine model

events.description:
Our monthly talks / hacks / meetups. At our NEW location: The National Museum of Computing, Bletchley Park.

Tonight, we'll be taking a look at serverless technologies, such as Kubernetes, BigQuery, DataFlow, Cloud Build and the Firebase suite, looking at the RealTime Database, Authentication, Cloud Firestore and Cloud Functions. We'll focus mainly on the Javascript SDK for any demos. However, if anyone has any experience of Swift / Java / Kotlin / Flutter, please feel free to join in.

If you want to try some things out for yourself, bring a laptop. Ideally, you'll want to be running Linux or OS X.

events.name: General talks

venue.name: GirlsCode Office, Block E, Bletchley Park
venue.address_1: Bletchley Park, next to the submarine model

events.description:
Our monthly talks / hacks / meetups.

This month we'll be covering a few of the announcements from Cloud Next London, the TensorFlow summit and the Firebase Summit, followed by a couple of workshops on NoSQL data modelling and TensorFlow.
events.how_to_find_us: Go through the gate (opposite Bletchley railway station) and turn right. At the security gate, say that you are going to the museum.  Follow the road to the left and go straight on at the roundabout.  The museum will be in front of you.

events.name: GDG MK seasonal get-together
events.description:
This month we'll host our usual monthly talks, a guided tour of the museum and have a bit of a party, to celebrate the end of our first proper year.

Our guest speaker is Kannappan Sirchabesan from Google, who will be giving a talk on Serverless Machine Learning using Google Cloud

events.name: General talks - Google Assistant
events.description:
Our monthly talks / hacks / meetups

From ‘Hey Google what time is it’ to ‘Hey Google launch my app’

Amanda will present the fundamental concepts for building an Action for Actions on Google and Dialogflow. Now you will not only be a user interacting with virtual assistants but also learn how you can build your own action!

About Amanda
Amanda Cavallaro is a software developer and a Google Dev Expert for Actions on Google. She is passionate about Cloud technologies and Human-Computer Interactions. You can speak to her in Portuguese, English, Italian and a little bit of Japanese.
events.how_to_find_us: Head into the car park, which is a one way system and park in any free parking bay. Please RSVP so security knows who you are.

events.name: Machine learning on Google Cloud
events.description:
This workshop will cover from beginners to in-depth content on Machine Learning on Google Cloud.

Starting from an introductory level, we will be advancing in difficulty with the succeeding sessions. Attendees will be able to take training material home and continue from there with support.

Agenda
This is a 4 hour training starting from 5.30 pm to 9.30 pm:
5:30 pm: Registration and refreshments
5:45 pm: A tour of Qwiklabs and GCP and getting started with Cloud Shell & gcloud
6:45 pm: Cloud Natural Language API: Qwik Start + Video Intelligence: Qwik Start
7:45 pm: Break
8:00 pm: Classify Images of Cloud Using Cloud ML API
8:45 pm: Implementing an AI Chatbot with Dialogflow
9:30 pm: Workshop close

Objectives
At the end of this 4 hours course, participants will be able to:
Get hands-on practice with the Google Cloud Platform’s fundamental tools and services.
Understand how Qwiklabs platform works for personal practice.

Audience
You will come in with little or no prior cloud knowledge, and come out with practical experience that you can apply to your first GCP project.
Application​ ​developers, Web Developers,​ ​Cloud​ ​Solutions Architects,​ ​DevOps​ ​Engineers,​ ​IT managers.
Individuals​ ​using​ ​Google​ ​Cloud​ ​Platform to​ ​create​ ​new​ ​solutions​ ​or​ ​to​ ​integrate existing​ ​systems, application environments,​​​ ​and​ ​infrastructure​ ​with the​ ​Google​ ​Cloud​ ​Platform.

Prerequisites
As an attendee, we recommend that you meet these prerequisites:
Assumes little to no prior knowledge in cloud computing or with the Google Cloud Platform. It is expected that students have an information technology or computing background, and have some hands-on familiarity with administering computing systems. Prior work with shell environments / command line interfaces will be helpful for completing the labs in this series.

The trainer
Abdallah Abedraba is part of the Developer Relations team at Google helping to drive developers success and awareness of the Open Standards & Google Technologies by working closely with Developer Communities. A third Palestinian, a third Kenyan and a third Spanish, he loves strongly typed programming languages, Free & Open Source Software, maths, chess, hiking and a good morning run! You can find him on Twitter at @aabedraba
events.how_to_find_us: Head into the car park, which is a one way system and park in any free parking bay. Please RSVP so we can let security know who you are. You may not be allowed on the premises if you don't RSVP!!!

events.name: An Introduction to Building Apps for the Google Assistant
events.description:
This combined talk and workshop will start at the beginners level on Building Apps for the Google Assistant.

Starting from an introductory level, you will gain an understanding of the basic concepts and consider use cases while getting hands on experience in practical workshops in this and succeeding sessions.

It begins with the Talk
Zero to App: Introduction to Building Apps for the Google Assistant

Actions on Google is an exciting way to interact with your users through the Google Assistant. It provides a conversational interface between you and your user, and these are simple to build with Dialogflow.
Not sure how to start developing your very first Action on Google?
Not to worry, in this talk, we’ll cover everything from understanding the business use cases and the high level voice user interface (VUI) design best practices to implementation, testing, and, finally, publishing your app. By the end of this session, you should have a better understanding of the Assistant service ecosystem and how to get started.

We then move to a Workshop
Google Assistant Development 101: Foundation Hands-On Workshop

Actions on Google is a new, exciting developer platform that lets you extend the functionality of the Google Assistant across over 1 billion devices, including smart speakers, displays, phones, cars, TVs, watches, headphones, and more.
Curious about how to start developing your very first Action on Google? In this workshop, you’ll learn how to build Google Assistant apps using Dialogflow and Firebase, test, and, finally, publish them. We’ll also explore the necessary concepts of voice user interface (VUI) and best practices for implementing Actions on Google that give users high-quality conversational experiences.

Agenda
This is a 2.5 hour training
10:00 am: Registration and refreshments
10:15 am: Talk - Zero to App: Introduction to Building Apps for the Google Assistant
10:45 am: Break
11:00 am: Google Assistant Development 101: Foundation Hands-On Workshop
12:30 pm: Workshop close

Objectives
At the end of this 2.5 hours training, you will be able to:
Understand why you should consider Building Apps for the Google Assistant for yourself or your company.
Get hands-on practice with the Google Assistant platform covering fundamental tools and services.

Audience
You will come in with little or no prior cloud knowledge, and come out with practical experience that you can apply to your first Google Assistant project.
Application​ ​developers, Web Developers,​ ​Cloud​ ​Solutions Architects,​ ​DevOps​ ​Engineers,​ ​IT managers.
Individuals​ ​thinking about creative new ​solutions​ ​or​ ​to​ ​integrate existing​ ​systems, application environments,​​​ ​and​ ​infrastructure​ ​with the​ ​Google​ ​Cloud​ ​Platform.

Prerequisites
As an attendee, we recommend that you meet these prerequisites:
Assumes little to no prior knowledge in cloud computing or with the Google Assistant or Actions on Google. It is expected that you will have an information technology or computing background, and have some hands-on familiarity with computing systems. Bring your personal (not work) laptop and charger.

Your trainer
Dr. Aygul Zagidullina is a Google Developer Expert (GDE) for Assistant based in London, UK. Her work experience includes Google, Todoist, MotaWord. She holds a PhD in quantum chemistry and prior to Google dedicated 6 years to scientific research at the University of Stuttgart. Aygul is a very active member of the London digital ecosystem and has been involved in many innovative projects. She is a Google Developer Group (GDG) London lead, Google Women Techmakers (WTM) London ambassador, Google Launchpad mentor, Google Product Expert (PE), Google Trusted Tester (TT), AnitaB.org London lead, Women in Voice (WiV) London lead, and UK STEM Ambassador (Code Club and CoderDojo mentor, Devoxx4Kids UK co-organizer). She was named as one of The NEXT 100 Top Influencers of the European Digital Industry in 2013.
@aygul
